New Records: Shohei Ohtani reached a career-high 104 runs this season, surpassing his 2021 mark with the Los Angeles Angels. He also pursued the record of becoming the first major leaguer with 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the third inning and stole two bases. The Dodgers rallied from a 3-1 deficit to score four runs and take a 5-3 lead in the third inning. The Orioles trimmed their deficit to 5-4 on Ryan O'Hearn's RBI double.
Pre-Game Insights: The game featured a sellout crowd of 53,290 and a ceremonial first pitch handled by Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy. The Orioles led 3-1 in the second inning due to miscues by the Dodgers.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers starter Walker Buehler was frustrated after allowing four runs and was replaced in the fifth inning. Orioles reliever Anthony Banda pitched 1 1/3 innings for the victory, and Michael Kopech recorded his 12th save.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles announced that 2B-SS Jorge Mateo had elbow surgery, ending his season. Dodgers pitcher Tyler Glasnow was set to resume throwing Friday, and Yoshinobu Yamamoto was scheduled for a rehab start next week.
